Dialogue: I’m sorry, I got ahead of myself.
Hi there, you on the table. I wonder if you’d mind taking a brief survey.
Now, I know you’re sleepy, but I just bet it’ll make you feel right as rain.
I’d be just thrilled to chat once we’ve run the survey. Shall we begin with question one?
Shall we begin with question one?
What do I get at the end?
Great. Off we go. Now to start, who are you?
It’s okay. If you can’t answer the question, feel free to say, “unknown.”
Question two, in which US state or territory were you born?
Question three, please name any US state or territory.
I don’t know. Delaware. What is this?
Question four, what is Mr. Eagan’s favorite breakfast?
I don’t… That one makes no sense.
Right? Unknown. Question five. And as a reminder, this is the final question. To the best of your memory, what is or was the color of your mother’s eyes?
Unknown. So that’s unknown, unknown, Delaware, unknown, unknown.
What the hell did you do to me?
Are you ready for Mr. Scout?
All right, see you this evening.
If you breathe on me, I’ll rip your larynx out.
Wow. That went right to ten. I feel like ripping out my germ-ridden larynx would get you sicker than just me breathing on you.
Petey better not be out for the day, ’cause I’m about zero seconds from wrapping the Tumwater file, and he needs to process it.
If he doesn’t process today, they won’t know until Tuesday of next week. It’s typical Lumon bullshit.
Goddamn it, Irv. We warned you.
About the greeting? You were kidding.
No, we sincerely hate it. How many reasons did we come up with?
Chief among them the latent condescension.
And it’s confusing. Like, did the kids make you dinner in this scenario? Or…
Yeah. What kind of a shit dad are you?
Oh, no. And Dylan’s about to wrap Tumwater today.
Yeah, and if he doesn’t see me finish, I might get passed over for refiner of the quarter and miss out on my goddamn waffle party.
Grumble, grumble. These perks are so out of hand. When we’d process a file in the old days, they’d shake our hand and fill up the creamer.
I still don’t buy they actually incentivized creamer.
They did. And back then, we were grateful for it.
Yes, very fucked. To put in an honest day’s work and not get a children’s breakfast in return.
Mark, could I have a word?
Last time you saw Ms. Cobel, she was in her old office. Now she’s in her new office. It’s a completely different office.
She’d never say so, but I know a compliment about the office would just make her day.
Mark? Come in. Shut the thing.
Yeah, the old one was better.
Oh… You look awful. You look hungover. Have a seat.
The Board will be joining us remotely today.
I have Mark S. at my desk.
Oh, uh, hello. I assume this is about me acting as department chief today. Okay. Well… I mean, I’ve subbed for Petey before, so it shouldn’t be that big a thing.
Petey is no longer with this company.
I said, Petey is no longer with this company.
I’m sorry, Mark. You guys were one of my favorite office friendships.
I mean, there should have been some notice of this. What happened?
We’d love to tell you, but unfortunately, non-disclosure policy forbids. We’d be aiding an assault on Petey’s privacy by you.
Mark, would you place your key card on my desk?
Mark S., at this time I confer upon you the freedom to serve Kier in the advanced role of Macrodata Refinement department chief. Congratulations.
Oh, a handshake is available upon request.
Thank you. May I have a handshake?
I know you haven’t run a training before, but Irving will be there to shadow. Just stick to the flowchart and escalate properly depending on dialectics. You’ll be fine.
If you need to take a few minutes…
Oh, and, uh, thank you to the Board as well.
The Board won’t be contributing to this meeting vocally.
Our last refiner, who was a woman, was…
I know you and Petey were close. He was the only one who really appreciated your humor.
Everything’s fine. So, I’m supposed to start with just the input survey? Isn’t that a little weird?
It’s standard. Just start at 1A and continue by line, based on her answers.
Well, what if I just talk to her?
She deserves to have the information presented to her in the proper order. Just as you had.
“If the trainee becomes agitated and demands to leave, skip to page 19.”
She has to ask three times for you to let her.
I just love seeing you all come in like this.
Go on ahead when you’re ready.
I’m sorry, I got ahead of myself.
Hi there, you on the table. I wonder if you’d mind taking a brief survey.
Five questions. Now, I know you’re sleepy, but I just bet it’ll make you feel right as rain.
I’d be just thrilled to chat, once we’ve run the survey. Shall we begin with question one?
Shall we begin with question one?
Let me out of here. Hey!
She’s not supposed to do that.
Now, I think I know where our disconnect is coming from.
Well, there was a preamble, which I was supposed to read before the survey, to lead into the questions and… But I unfortunately skipped that and went straight into the survey.
Like, did you grow me as food and that’s why I have no memories?
You think we grew a full human, gave you consciousness…
I don’t know. I don’t know you.
No, you’re not livestock. Good Lord.
Helly. Your name is Helly. Helly R.
Thank you for taking the welcome survey. I can sense that the questions made you feel afraid or disoriented. Well, the good news is, you’re at an orientation.
You see, you have been hired to a position on the Severed Floor of Lumon Industries.
I understand you’re confused about the severance procedure. Before we hop on that, let’s chat about something I bet you have heard of, the work/life balance. To start, imagine yourself as a seesaw.
Can we just take a beat? Please.
Okay, my name’s Mark. And, uh… So, I…
You know, few years back, I woke up on this table. In this room. And a disembodied voice asked me 19 times who I was.
And when I realized I couldn’t answer, I told that voice that I would find him and kill him.
I don’t know why I said that. I mean, I was scared too.
No, that voice’s name was Petey, and he became my best friend.
So, look, you know, there is a life to be had here, Helly.
Well, you see, life, like a seesaw, requi—
Let me the fuck out of here!
You’ve asked twice to be let go. Ask one more time.
I would like to leave the building now.
I understand you don’t feel it’s working out for you here at Lumon. While disappointed, I’d hate to keep you somewhere you’re not happy. So, let’s get you outta here.
The departments are pretty spaced out, but it’ll all fill in one day. They’re planning an expansion.
And I’m, what, part of that?
Replacement for who? Why are you saying that like you hate it?
Here’s your stairwell. Just past the bend.
Well, once you leave, you… I just can’t watch you leave.
This isn’t, like, hell or something?
Then why the fuck can’t I leave?
Well, you did leave, just now. Out into the stairwell at least.
You left, but you came back.

Weaponizing office equipment on your first day. You are gonna be fun. Look, I do sympathize. I’ve wanted to pummel Mark myself, but I am his employer. And he is your department chief. So we’ll both have to be strong. The good news is, there’s only one part left of your orientation, which Mark can’t possibly derail.
For the incompetence or the disobedience?

You know, my mother was an atheist. She used to say that there was good news and bad news about hell. The good news is, hell is just the product of a morbid human imagination. The bad news is, whatever humans can imagine, they can usually create.
I don’t know what that means.
A department like yours can go so good or so bad. You know what makes the difference? The people.
Okay, go ahead and have a seat.

My name is Helly R. I’m making this video roughly two hours before it will be shown to me. I have, of my own free accord, elected to undergo the procedure colloquially known as severance. I give consent for my perceptual chronologies to be surgically split, separating my memories between my work life and my personal life. I acknowledge that, henceforth, my access to my memories will be spatially dictated. I will be unable to access outside recollections whilst on Lumon’s severed basement floor, nor retain work memories upon my ascent. I am aware that this alteration is comprehensive and irreversible. I make these statements freely.
You’ll leave at 5:00. Well, actually, they stagger our exits, so 5:15. But it won’t feel like it. Not to this version of you anyway.
Well, every time you find yourself here, it’s because you chose to come back.
“Dear Mark, Whilst carrying boxes in a room today, you slipped on an overhead projector slide and sustained a minor blow to the temple.”
Maybe keep your eyes on the icy road.
Indeed, this gnat will spend much of its three to seven-day life…

No, I know, Mrs. Selvig. It’s just, it was in my space again. Yeah. Well, trash comes tomorrow night. Tonight’s recycling. Yeah, it is weird, but that’s how they do it. And with both yours, there’s no room for…
Do you wanna put on pants, and I’ll…
meet you in… Those are not pants.
So if there’s no dinner, how is it dinner?
You remember that time when we were kids and I was a way better sibling than you?
Also, I know we’re nearing the anniversary, so I just thought maybe you’d wanna be around people.
This is nice. When did you get it?
Something from work, and they apologized.
They apologized. Thank God. Did they tack an explanation onto that apology?
It’s fine. Got a gift card.
You got a gift card. Where’s he going to?
Of course it’s Pip’s. Well, enjoy.
No, what a lot of people overlook, I think, is that life is not food.
this complex quality of sentience and activity. And then you’ve got food, which is what?
Calories. It’s not the same thing.
Yes, that is spot on, Patton.
Though, if I’m…Sorry, Mark and my dad used to have “whiskey is life” carved on a flask.
He did. He was a misdiagnosed alcoholic.
Now, Mark, Ricken told Rebeck and me that you’re a former history professor.
So, I’m curious for your take on all of this. The food v life of it.
Well, I’m not sure. I taught mostly about World War I.
Okay. Well, I got one for you. I was just reading this think piece about the comparative levels of violence and warfare throughout history.
But anyway, in it, he said that the people actually called it the Great War. Apparently, it would have been a faux pas to have called it World War I.
Well, you know, no one would’ve called it World War I ’cause World War II hadn’t happened yet.
This is why we bring this guy.
Mark’s late wife, Gemma, was an educator as well. Russian literature.
But Mark is a Lumon man now.
I thought Lumon was more on the tech side of things.
Yeah, but I’m in the corporate archives division, so…
So you know all the dirty secrets.
Mark’s work is sensitive enough as to require the severance procedure.
Yeah. It’s also, I think, something that’s his choice to tell people or not.
No. It’s okay. I don’t care.
I mean, I wish I could do it. I’d just always be thinking about, you know, the other one.
Well, there is no other one. It’s me. I do the job.
I just don’t grasp the visceral element. What does it feel like?
Well, it’s simple. One’s memories are bifurcated, so when you’re not at work, you have no recollection of what it is you do there. Did I get that right, Mark?
So you walk in at 9:00 a.m.,
and then suddenly it’s 5:00, and you’re leaving?
Well, they stagger us a little, so…
And then, conversely, when you’re at work, you can’t access outside memories. So, in effect, that version of you is trapped there.
Well, I mean, not trapped, but…
No, no. I’m curious. What were you gonna say? But not trapped, but what? What were you gonna say?
So, I suppose we know where you fall on the congressional goings-on.
Okay, I think we may be
The point is that Mark made a decision. And that decision was controversial, ethically and socially. Morally. Scientifically. But, Mark, I stand behind you without reservation.
Wow. Thank you. That’s very sweet.
Well, we’re at the point where, traditionally, I would say something like, “Dig in.” But I must say, I do think that the lack of food has allowed us to already do so on a much deeper level.
I was saying, my friend in Lima hasn’t had a food-based dinner event in…
If I give you $3,000, will you forgive me?
Well, because your child is innocent of tonight’s atrocities, I’ll wait until after it’s born to murder you.
Oh, my God. Here you go, buddy.
Hey, how’s the good doctor therapy man with that weird little mustache?
I’m proud of you for taking that job. I really am. And I think she would’ve been too. I know she would’ve been.
I just feel like forgetting about her for eight hours a day isn’t the same thing as healing.
You wanna crash here, since you’re already here?
Yeah, I’m just not grasping the visceral element of it.
I’m making all the bedsheets myself, so I won’t finish with the big one for some time. But the twin is comfortable, and the pajamas were made on a Baltic handloom, so you’ll sleep well.
Thanks. I still don’t quite get the three beds.
Ricken’s colleague told us that switching out the beds as the child grows can wound that child.
But if you provide said child with all of its beds upon birth, you allow it to progress across the room at its own rate.
I think people really enjoyed you tonight, Mark.
There was a businessman in the yard last night.
There was seriously a man in my yard last night?
He, you know, looked at me weird, like he knew me.
Did the prowler invading my home make you feel seen?
Well, there’s a bar down the hill. It’s probably just a stumbler. Speaking of which, you still smell like a distillery.
I’m sorry, I just had to drown out the memory of Mom and Dad switching out my beds
You’ve been sitting on that one.
Okay. So, recycling was last night, Mrs. Selvig. Tonight’s garbage. And you keep putting your bin on my side. So…
You know, I actually can’t talk right now. I’m out at dinner. But…
I’m sorry, Mrs. Selvig. They’ve cooked the food, and it’s here.
I’m sorry. You don’t get that reference.
Your voice is different here. Worse.
Okay, who the fuck are you?
My name is Petey. I’m from work.
Well, that’s not plausible. Everyone in my department is…
Okay. Well, severance is pretty permanent.
Yeah. Bypassing the implant wasn’t easy. I had help.
So, what, you were unhappy at work?
And instead of lodging a complaint, you…
I tried that first. So did you.
Right. Okay. So…You’ve unsevered. And now you, what, think they’re after you or something?
Yeah. “They” being Graner, who’s probably out here right now.
Graner. Okay. Is that, like, a person you know or…
We both know him. We don’t like him.
Nothing down there is what they say. If something happens to me, the things I know need to stay known. I’d prefer it be by a friend.
I’m your best friend. You’re my very good friend.

Mark, sorry about the card. and I know it’s not appropriate. Though I’m sure you’d be a really fucking awesome niece. We used to wonder what kind of men we were on the outside, what choices we had made and why. I used to think it would take a monster to put someone in a place like that office. Especially if the person was himself. But we’re not monsters, Mark. Not real ones.
If you don’t wanna know what’s going on down there, I won’t force it. But if you do, there’s an address on the back of this card. Go alone, and you’ll find the beginning of a very long answer.
Will you color me embarrassed for the mix-up with the bins?
Fine. I’m just, you know, tired.
You know, my mother was a Catholic. She used to say it takes the saints eight hours to bless a sleeping child. I hope you aren’t rushing the saints.
Well, I’ll give them ample time tonight. Good night, Mrs. Selvig.

I acknowledge that, henceforth, my access to my memories will be spatially dictated. I will be unable to access outside recollections whilst on Lumon’s severed basement floor, nor retain work memories upon my ascent. I am aware that this alteration is comprehensive and irreversible. I make these statements freely.
Okay, that’s a wrap. Come with me, please.
So, your work personage will be waking in a few hours on the severed floor. But the next time you yourself will be sentient will be this evening, in the elevator back up.
The elevator has a handrail at hip-level if you feel dizzy.
Oh, man. I love seeing the sunrise on his face.
You know he used to drink three raw eggs in milk each morning?
We’ll get you prepped in here.
I’ll be upstairs after to let you know how it went.
Sorry if I freak out on you a little.
Don’t worry. I’m very excited to meet you.
Your orientation’s been so much fun.
Okay, so sometimes when a new hire is adjusting to a severed space, we help by bringing them here to the stairwell, to experience the transition viscerally.
Oh, no. I’m trying to leave?
No, no. It’s all part of the process. If you wanna spin around and head back in, that should be that.
That’s okay. Not a problem. Wanna give it another shot? Maybe with a little oomph?
Hi. I’m at the stairwell. It’s going fair. No, she’s…
I don’t wanna be in there, do I?
You’re learning that you do. Hey, when we heard you were coming here, it was like a miracle. It’s amazing what you’re doing.
I don’t even feel like I left.
Yeah, that’s how nights and weekends feel here.
Well, you get used to it. I mean, I find it helps to focus on the effects of sleep since we don’t actually get to experience it. You may feel rejuvenated or happy. Less tense in the shoulders. Spry.
Yeah, they stagger the entries too so we don’t meet on the outside. It’s important apparently.
So I guess we’re not friends.
My current file’s called “Tumwater”… which I started some 11 weeks back. “Tumwater.” All one word.

I’ve got it 96% sorted, which means I’ve earned four of the five tier incentives, including the erasers and the finger traps that you see displayed here. 100% is tier five. That gets you a caricature portrait. You’ll note I’ve accrued an embarrassment of wealth in that regard.
Each one of these? Finished file in the can.
Percentage-wise, yes. But if we hit our numbers by quarter’s end, one of us gets named refiner of the quarter, and that shit gets you a waffle party.
Okay, hazards on, eager lemur. I’m a dead lock for that this quarter, so don’t get your hopes up.
What about Mark’s crystal head cube?
That’s not a prize, that’s just something they gave him.
Helly, could you flip on this console?
Mark, sorry to interrupt. I know you’re training Helly. I just noticed you’ve removed the group photos from the desks.
Yeah. We’re gonna take the new ones at Helly’s party today.
Okay, this is the Siena file. Now, all the data you see falls into one of four essential categories. And we group each line of code, and then sort it evenly between five digital buckets.
Just poke around first. Use the arrows.
I do think the old photos are supposed to stay on the desk until the new ones come in.
Should this mean something to me?
No, all the data comes from upstairs fully encoded.
Then how do I categorize it?

Each category of numbers presents in such an order as to elicit an emotional response in the refiner. So, Cat 1 numbers, for example, feel a certain way on sight. They’ll be sort of disconcerting, scary.
My job is to scroll through this spreadsheet and look for numbers that are scary?
It sounds dumb, and Mark said it dumb.
Are the numbers bloody? Do they chant?
It doesn’t make sense till you see it, and it takes a while to see.
Hey, Mark. I just printed out the passage of the handbook on changing out group photos. Just might be good to peruse when you’re between things.
Like if it turns out I hate this and I want to quit, is that an option?
Look. If you’re really unhappy, you can submit a resignation request with your outside self for review.
And good luck getting that approved.
Well, they do tend to be rejected. Plus, you know…
Well, since this perceptual version of you only exists at Lumon, I mean, quitting would effectively end your life. I mean, in so much as you’ve come to know it.
I’m agog at how well I can tell you’re already fitting in. The office feels whole. Now, let’s get this party started.
Well, my name is Irving, as you all know. And I’ve worked here for three years, and something about me is that I know all nine core Lumon principles.
All nine. But today, I think I’d say, “cheer”.
Hello, I’m Helly. I’ve been at Lumon for, like…ten hours total, and…
I’m sorry, I don’t know anything about myself.
I really don’t. I guess I went home last night, but I don’t know if home is a house, or an apartment, or if I live with a family…
I like to think my Outie lives on, like, a riverboat.
You saw yours yesterday in the video.
Right. I actually have a few things to say to her. Can I record something back?
So, what you’ll find here is that communication between selves is pretty curtailed.
So, what if I write her a note?
Fortunately, the elevators are equipped with something called “code detectors.” So messages can’t be passed through.
Yeah… They’re like metal detectors for written symbols. A Lumon original, apparently.
Sure. Okay, well what if I…
I don’t think you’re quite getting the game here, Helly. May I?

Guys, this is Helly. She’s thirty years old, she’s allergic to almonds and has weak enamel. At 5′6″, she’s the fourth tallest person in your office, and her hair is what we call shoulder-length. And seeing her here with you all, I’d say she most definitely has a family.
Wow. Well, that’s a lot to follow. So, I’ll just say that I’m Mark. Been with Lumon about two years, and I absolutely love this game.
Nice try, pal, but you said that last time.
Fair enough. Well, I…I broke protocol this morning.
I was dusting the old group photos, the ones with Petey, and it just…made me feel sad. And, I guess, worried that I won’t be able to run MDR like he did.
That tracks. I have similar worries.
So I…took ’em from the cubicles and put ’em in the storage closet, which we’re not supposed to do.
Thank you for telling me, Mark. I actually find your reaction sweet. Though, it is puzzling you have an outburst like this for Petey, and not for, say, Carol D.
But we knew Carol D. was leaving beforehand. I mean, her Outie filmed a thank-you. Petey was just gone.
And I mean, I… I don’t know if he’s at some new job or drunk on a beach, or dead…

I think this is a good time to remind ourselves that things like deaths happen outside of here. Not here. A life at Lumon is protected from such things. And I think a great potential response to that from all of you is gratitude.
I also think that melon isn’t getting any tastier.
Hey, sorry I derailed your game.
I thought I already had, but then, yeah, you made it way worse.
So, how are you gonna figure out if Petey’s okay?
I think Milchick was pretty clear.
You’re just done asking about your best friend because our babysitter told you to stop?
You know, Milchick’s a nice man. When he says something, it’s best to listen.
’Cause he can’t always be nice like that.
Let’s get this new group photo before the melon bloat sets in.
All right. Great big smiles. Remember, you’re gonna be looking at this every day.
I just think I’m not gonna work here anymore. Sorry.
I don’t wanna do the file-sorting thing or the never-seeing-the-sun-thing or the disappearing-friends thing.
I just don’t want any of it.
We told you there’s code detectors.
Do you know that? Have you tried? Because frankly, it sounds made-up.
Perhaps you’d better come with me.
Hey. I see you’ve found my wayward trainee. Appreciate your help, sir, as always.
The note. So, this is embarrassing, but it’s my first time training, and I must’ve just forgotten to go over data-smuggling rules with Helly.
Sorry. This is Helly. Helly, Mr. Graner.
Yeah, so if Helly tripped the code detectors, that one, it’s on me and I apologize for that, sir. Earnestly.
Big department chief now, Mark S.?
And how many deliveries have you, I don’t know, seen?
Over 300? This is mostly back in Montana.
Yeah. We get two a day. Depending.
So, is that, like, ten a week? Like, in a five-day work week, or…
Are you vetting me for your sister?
No. Oh, no. You seem great.
And half of me. That was a joke.
Yeah. I’m in the archives division, sort of a corporate historian, apparently. So, a lot of sensitive
So, you don’t know…who you work with, or what you do, or… or anything?
What if you snuck in a note?
you could have a girlfriend at Lumon…
…and not know it. And if you met someone out here, you wouldn’t know it in there. Like, you could get married and have kids, and just forget they exist for eight hours every day, for your whole life.
That doesn’t mess with your head?
I think for some people, it’s the point.
So, as a local, this just feels like a reasonable temperature to you?
Well, technically, I’m from Ganz. And you’re one to talk. Isn’t Minnesota, like, crazy cold with the lakes?
Yes. Minnesota was very cold the one time I visited from my home in Montana.
So do you live in Lumon housing?
You make it sound like dorms or something.
No, I just meant that there’s…
And, yes, they happen to be subsidized by the company that employs me.
Excuse me, do you have a moment for children’s brain health?
And legalized severance in the workplace?
Nice. The WMC’s out and about.
Most severed workers don’t see the sun their whole lives.
The Whole Mind Collective. They’re great.
Excuse me, do you have a moment for children’s brain health?
You folks have a moment for children’s brain health?
We’re trying to get a measure on the ballot to keep mega-corporations like Lumon from continuing to force legalized severance on our state.
That’s what they’re lobbying for. And Jame Eagan is trying to sever kids…

Okay, well, what about the self-mutilating types who do it willingly? I mean, I heard that some of them are so deluded they don’t even know they’re victims. I also heard that if you’re severed, you go to two separate hells. Is that true?
Hey, man, you wanna benefit off forced labor, that’s up…
So people can just, like, self-imprison? Are you captive right now? No, seriously, because your past self chose to walk you down here to be an infantilizing prick to people.
That’s nice language for a… What… What are you? Twelve? Are you 12 years old? Are you even in high school yet?
I just keep thinking about those damn bins.
Well, that is so not necessary, but very kind. Thank you.
Here, why don’t you come in? I have milk.
I’m experimenting with chamomile, so no hard feelings if you gag.
Still waiting for that third bulb to revive itself?
Oh, yeah. Keep forgetting to change that.
My, you smell nice. Were you on a date?
Sort of. My sister set me up with, like, her doula, or midwife. Didn’t really feel like anything.
Wow. This i… These are magic.

My late husband was a carpenter, and before he passed, he said he would start building us a house in the hereafter. And there would be a small guest apartment in the back, in case I found a new man before I got there.
Yes. He even drew blueprints, which I keep in my purse.
Well, come by the shop, okay? I’ll give you a mugwort bath bomb that’ll make you sleep like a rag doll.
I’ll try to get down there. Good night, Mrs. Selvig.
The nerve, my new partner’s a woman.
I just think you could’ve mentioned it sooner.
You’d better be on the stakeout and not… out for a steak.
Mr. Milchick, it’s Mark Scout. I’m a severed worker. Employee number 4502.
Mr. Scout, what a pleasure. How can I help you?
I actually woke up not feeling terribly well. I’m sorry I’m just now calling.
Oh, no. May I ask how serious it is?
Well, nothing bad, just very minor stomach event. Should be back tomorrow.
Well, I’m sorry. I know your Innie will be sad to have missed the day. You feel better. Okay, Mr. Scout?
He should be coming down first now. You don’t think that…
He’s probably sick. They wouldn’t bounce him and Petey the same week.
I certainly hope not. Quarterly deadline’s coming up, and I’m not looking to be department chief.
Wow. Lotta confidence for a man who once got disciplined for dozing.
I can’t help that I was hired older than you.
They wouldn’t have fired him for my note thing, would they?
No. No way. He did his stint in the break room yesterday.
